comment._content: It would be very interesting to know where in Egypt this picture was made, or what the man's background was.

comment.author: 91271949@N00
comment._content: The title is: "Derwiche pelerin" so this man is a "traveling sufi man", a "pelgrim derwish".

comment.author: 18581316@N07
comment._content:
well, i don't think he's an egyptian. from his appearance i can tell that he's a Bedouin! it's very obvious 'cause in Egypt men don't wear this kind of outfits specially in the 1800's when it was part of The Ottoman Empire! i guess he's a Bedouin from the Arabian peninsula who traveled to Egypt! that's what i believe!
very interesting picture! :)

comment._content: Looks like a beautiful downwardly mobile version of the famous portrait of George Gordon Lord Byron.  Could even be based on it as it comes later.

comment.author: 16578962@N07
comment._content:
i'm an Egyptian,, lived my whole life in Egypt, and have of course seen a lot of old pictures and films,,, but ive never seen something like this before!
i have to agree with Thahab,, he might have been a beduin on a tour to Egypt or something,,, i dont think he's Egyptian.
